thread.title: MP Catherine McKinnell joins Labour conference march calling for second Brexit vote

author: Jonathan Walker
title: MP Catherine McKinnell joins Labour conference march calling for second Brexit vote
text:
MP Catherine McKinnell joins Labour conference march calling for second Brexit vote The Newcastle MP is supporting Labour activists who want a 'People's Vote' Share MP Catherine McKinnell (Image: Newcastle Chronicle) Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Newcastle MP Catherine McKinnell plans to join a march at Labour’s annual conference in Liverpool to back a “people’s vote” on leaving the EU.
The march, on Sunday, has been billed as a show of solidarity with delegates attending the conference who plan to call on Labour to support a second referendum on Brexit.
Supporters of the people’s vote campaign say the country should be allowed to decide whether to accept any deal agreed with the EU or not.
Alternatively, if no deal can be agreed then voters should be asked whether they want to press ahead with Brexit on that basis. Read More North East employers say Brexit will hurt their businesses and the region's economy
Ms McKinnell , Labour MP for Newcastle North, said: “We are due to leave the EU in just over six months time, and the Prime Minister’s strategy for negotiating a Brexit deal has been a total and utter failure to date.
“This is not a time for grandstanding and brinkmanship because leaving the EU without a deal - or a bad deal - could have a catastrophic impact on the North East and local jobs. Read More Threat of cuts to CrossCountry services through Newcastle, Durham and Berwick is lifted
“I am not prepared to see this country being led off a cliff, and I firmly believe the only democratic resolution to this mess is to give the people the final say on what should take place.
“I’m looking forward to joining the march on Sunday, as the demand for a People’s Vote becomes louder every day.” Like us on Facebook
